thread.title: Pep Guardiola Comments on 'Unacceptable' Treatment of Arsenal Boss Arsene Wenger
thread.title_full: Pep Guardiola Comments on 'Unacceptable' Treatment of Arsenal Boss Arsene Wenger

author: Chris Laker
title: Pep Guardiola Comments on 'Unacceptable' Treatment of Arsenal Boss Arsene Wenger
text: Pep Guardiola Comments on 'Unacceptable' Treatment of Arsenal Boss Arsene Wenger Michael Regan/Getty Images Chris Laker Featured Columnist February 20, 2017 Pep Guardiola has come out in defence of under-fire Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger , branding the recent treatment of the Frenchman as "unacceptable." Wenger saw his side outclassed by Bayern Munich in a 5-1 Champions League last-16 drubbing on Feb. 15, leading to calls for him to end his 20-year reign at the club. But after watching his Manchester City team held to a goalless draw by Huddersfield Town in the FA Cup fifth round, Guardiola hit out at criticism of Wenger, per Mark Crellin of Sky Sports. "What I hear in the last 10 days, about how people, ex-players, journalists, treat Arsene Wenger is unacceptable," he said."Our job, in that moment, doesn't have any respect for any position, so it is not respectable what happened." More to follow.
